>>Weather Nizhny Novgorod

The climatic conditions in Nizhny Novgorod are mostly characterized by a frigid and moderate climate. In Nizhny Novgorod, precipitation is notable throughout the entirety of the year, with even its most arid month still experiencing a considerable amount of rainfall. Köppen and Geiger classify this climate as Dfb. The temperature here averages 5.3 °C | 41.5 °F. The annual precipitation in this location is approximately 683 mm | 26.9 inch.

The designated area is positioned within the northern hemisphere of our globe. The warm and pleasant days of the Summer season commence towards the conclusion of June and come to an end in September. This particular period includes a span of months, namely: June, July, August, September.

Climate graph // Weather by Month Nizhny Novgorod

In March, the precipitation level plummets to a mere 39 mm | 1.5 inch. This month holds the title for being exceptionally arid. The maximum quantity of rainfall is observed during the month of June, exhibiting an average value of 78 mm | 3.1 inch.

average temperature by month Nizhny Novgorod

The month of highest temperature is July during which the average temperature reaches up to 20.3 °C | 68.6 °F. During the month of January, there is a notable drop in temperature, with an average low of approximately -9.1 °C | 15.6 °F.

The precipitation variance between the months with the lowest and highest levels of rainfall is 39 mm | 2 inch. The degree of fluctuation in the yearly temperature is approximately 29.4 °C | 53.0 °F.

In terms of relative humidity, the month that exhibits the highest level is December with a percentage of 62.35. Conversely, May has been recorded as having the lowest amount of relative humidity at only 62.35. It is noteworthy that October has the highest number of rainy days, amounting to 12.63, whereas the month with the least rainfall is April, experiencing only 9.13 wet days.
